Spherical Coordinates¶

The Spherical coordinates property holds the point cloud in (azimuth, elevation, range) coordinate frame. There are multiple ways achieving this, either by direct computing over a numpy array or using spark.

Spherical Property¶

class SphericalCoordinatesProperty.SphericalCoordinatesProperty(points, *args)[source]¶

Spherical coordinates property of a certain PointSet Object Angular coordinates are in decimal degrees

Azimuths¶
ElevationAngles¶
Ranges¶

Return type:PointSet

getValues()[source]¶

Get a specific characteristic value of the property

Returns:value for each point
Return type:np.array

Warning

This function needs to be overwritten for each inheriting property. It is empty at the BaseProperty

SphericalCoordinates Factory¶

class SphericalCoordinatesFactory.SphericalCoordinatesFactory[source]¶
static CartesianToSphericalCoordinates(points, ceval=<function evaluate>)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • points – a pointset containing the points to transform to spherical
  • ceval – backend to use: - eval: pure Numpy - numexpr.evaluate (default): Numexpr (faster for large arrays)
Returns:

spherical coordinates property in degrees
Return type:

SphericalCoordinatesProperty
cart2sph_RDD(points, sc)[source]¶

Cartesian to spherical transformation via RDD.

Parameters:
  • points (PointSet) – a point set to be transformed
  • sc – a spark context object (driver) that will run the job

:type SparkContext

Returns:RDD holding the spherical coordinates
Return type:pySpark RDD
